body.p:
To His Excellency
Gov B. Magoffin
My Dear Sir

It is with feelings of the most profound regret that I now tender to you my resignation of the office of Secretary of State -- You will sufficiently understand without more explanation the causes which induce me thus abruptly to sever official relations which to me have been of the most agreeable character -- You will know too, the controlling necessity of this step on my part at a time when under other circumstances I would feel especial pride in standing by you with the feeble aid in my power --

Allow me to thank you for your uniform kindness courtesy & friendship. The u invariable confidence you have given me, is appreciated deeply in my part, & will enable me at all times when malignity shall assail or slander attack you, to bear my testimony to the high purpose, the purity of motive, the disinterested patriotism, the perfect integrity, firmness & ability which have characterized your official & private course under circumstances & throughout a period perhaps the most trying, the most perilous, and important ever experienced by the Chief magistrate of any state of the confederacy. With the deepest interest in your success, the entire confidence that time will demonstrate your noble & pure efforts for the public good and the warmest sympathy with you in all your public & domestic anxieties

I am most truly, your grateful Friend
Thos B. Monroe Jr.
Pre

Secretary of
State
Resignation of Tho. B. Monroe Jr.
Oct. 2d. 1861

His Excellency
B. Magoffin
Frankfort
